com.sonyericsson.capuchin
Class FlashDataRequest

java.lang.Object
  com.sonyericsson.capuchin.FlashDataRequest

public final class FlashDataRequest
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a data request originated from Flash.

The DataRequest is used by Flash content for requesting data in form of properties from the Java side.

These properties name don’t need to be predefined in ActionScript, they will be set completely with name and value in Java using setProperty(String, String) and setProperty(String, int). However both Java programmers and Flash designers have to agree about the properties names and expected values.

See FlashDataRequestListener for code example using this class.

Method Summary
 void complete()
          Completes this request and makes available the properties to Flash.
 java.lang.String[] getArgs()
          Returns the data request constructor arguments.
 void setProperty(java.lang.String name, int value)
          Sets an integer property associated with this data request.
 void setProperty(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets a String property associated with this data request.

Method Detail

getArgs

public java.lang.String[] getArgs()
Returns the data request constructor arguments.

Returns:
a String array containing the arguments passed to the request constructor in Flash. See FlashDataRequestListener for code example using this method.

setProperty

public void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String value)

Sets a String property associated with this data request.

By setting properties, data is transferred from Java to Flash.

After setting a property its value can not be removed, but it can be modified by calling this method again.

This method should not be called after the request has been completed by calling complete() .

Parameters:
name - the property name to be set.
value - the value of the property to be set in the request.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this request has been completed, by calling {link complete() See FlashDataRequestListener for code example using this method.

setProperty

public void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
                        int value)

Sets an integer property associated with this data request.

By setting properties, data is transferred from Java to Flash.

After setting a property its value can not be removed, but it can be modified by calling this method again.

This method should not be called after the request has been completed by calling complete() .

Parameters:
name - the property name to be set.
value - the value of the property to be set in the request.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this request has been completed after {link complete() has been called. See FlashDataRequestListener for code example using this method.

complete

public void complete()

Completes this request and makes available the properties to Flash.

After calling this method it is not possible to set new properties in this request.
